alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 15 at 9:24AM MDT until June 19 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River and stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 916 AM MDT, emergency management reported localized flooding in the advisory area, especially along Little Goose Creek and in the City of Sheridan. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area this evening into Friday morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sheridan and Big Horn. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
